citations.narrative:
A self-reported incident occurred on May 22, 2024, at 12:30 pm. A member of the public notified the zoo that one Lemur
was seen on the boardwalk adjacent to the Lemur’s enclosure. Animal care staff quickly caught the lemur and crated him.
When another staff member was on her way to help, she saw another Lemur next to the boardwalk. She caught the
animal and crated him too. Both animas were caught within 10 minutes of the incident report.
Housing nonhuman primates’ facilities should be constructed and maintained in good repair to prevent injury to the
animals, to contain the animals and prevent other animals from entering. The facility evaluated potential escape routes
and took action to prevent this incident from happening again.
Corrected prior to inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.75(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
A self-reported incident occurred on May 22, 2024, at 12:30 pm. A member of the public notified the zoo that one Lemur 
was seen on the boardwalk adjacent to the Lemur’s enclosure. Animal care staff quickly caught the lemur and crated him. 
When another staff member was on her way to help, she saw another Lemur next to the boardwalk. She caught the 
animal and crated him too. Both animas were caught within 10 minutes of the incident report. 
 
Housing nonhuman primates’ facilities should be constructed and maintained in good repair to prevent injury to the 
animals, to contain the animals and prevent other animals from entering. The facility evaluated potential escape routes 
and took action to prevent this incident from happening again. 
 
Corrected prior to inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
 n

species.common: RUFOUS BROWN LEMUR / RED BROWN LEMUR
